ISSUE.TITLE: --platform does not work when using Docker CLI
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Issue Description When Podman is configured to provide `docker.sock` and the Docker CLI is used to invoke `docker run --platform=`, the platform is ignored, and it runs whatever the latest pulled image is. ### Steps to reproduce the issue ``` $ podman run --rm -it --platform=linux/amd64 ubuntu:focal arch ... x86_64 $ podman run --rm -it --platform=linux/aarch64 ubuntu:focal arch ... aarch64 $ docker run --rm -it --platform=linux/amd64 ubuntu:focal arch aarch64 $ ls -l /var/run/docker.sock lrwxr-xr-x 1 root daemon 61 Jun 20 17:04 /var/run/docker.sock -> ~/.local/share/containers/podman/machine/podman.sock ``` ### Describe the results you received The third command is incorrect; even though `linux/amd64` is specified, the architecture of the container is reported as `aarch64`. ### Describe the results you expected Podman should see that the platform of the tagged image is not `linux/amd64` and so it should pull the tag with the correct platform. ### podman info output ```yaml host: arch: arm64 buildahVersion: 1.30.0 cgroupControllers: -
